citation.article-title: Thermohydrogenium kirishiense gen. nov. and sp. nov., a new anaerobic thermophilic bacterium

p.s: Description of Thermohydrogenium gen. nov.

Morphology. Rods 0.4-0.8 x 1.0-11.0 μm. Cells are alone, arranged in pairs or short chains; non-motile. Stained gram-negative at all phases of culture growth, but lack of the outer membrane. Endospores not formed. The type of cell division is "intermediate" between division separation and constriction.
Physiology.
Obligate anaerobe.
Chemoorganoheterotroph.
Temperature optimum 65°C minimum 45°C maximum 75°C The growth is possible between pH value 5.0-8.0, optimum pH 7.0-7.4.
Use as nitrogen sources ammonium, urea, some amino acids, caseine hydrolisate, pepton and yeast extract.
The bacterium needs as well yeast extract (0.02%) as source of vitamins.
Fermentates glucose, fructose, sucrose, galactose, maltose, mannose, xylose and starch.
Utilizes also for growth pyruvate and yeast extract (> 1%) as energy and carbon sources.
The main glucose fermentation products are ethanol, acetate, H2 and CO2.
The minor product are isopropanol, butanol, butyrate and lactate.
Glucose is metabolized mainly via Embden-Meyerhoff-Parnas pathway.
The growth is not inhibited by a molecular hydrogen.
H2S is not formed from S0 and SO2-4.
Penicillin G, tetracyclin and streptomycin inhibited the growth of bacterium.
Polymyxin B and chloramphenicol did not.
Catalase, cytochromes and quinones are absent.
Genotypical characteristic.
DNA base composition is 33.2-34.0 mol% GC.

The DNA-DNA hybridization of different strains with Thermoanaerobium lactoethylicum ZE- 1, Thermobacteroides acetoethylicus HTB 2, Thermoanaerobacter ethanolicus 2246 and Clostridium thermohydrosulfuricum DSM 567 show that it had 8-25% of homology with these bacteria.
Habitat.
Industrial yeast biomass (town Kirishi, USSR) at the stages of thermal treatment.
Type strain. Thermohydrogenium kirshiense ZE-7 is deposited in the collection of the Department of Microbiology of Moscow State University.
